SEARCH
Package uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop

Class CollisionDetector

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.CollisionDetector
public final class CollisionDetector extends Object
A utility class for detecting collisions between vehicles in the railway simulation.

What is this class for?

This class checks if any two vehicles are too close to each other (occupying nearly the same space). This is used to detect crashes and prevent trains from running into each other.

Utility Class Pattern:

Like CouplingManager, this is a FINAL class with a PRIVATE constructor:

  • Cannot create instances (private constructor)
  • Cannot inherit from it (final keyword)
  • All methods are static

Example usage: 

 Collection<Vehicle> allVehicles = getVehicles();
 if (CollisionDetector.detectCollision(allVehicles)) {
     System.out.println("Collision detected!");
 }

How collision detection works:

The algorithm compares every pair of vehicles and calculates the distance between their centers. If the distance is less than half a cell (16 pixels), a collision is detected.

See Also:
  • Vehicle
  • Locomotive
  • Carriage

  • Method Details

    • detectCollision

      public static boolean detectCollision(Collection<? extends Vehicle> vehicles)
      Detects if any two vehicles in the collection are colliding.

      How it works:

      1. Convert the collection to an array for easy iteration
      2. Compare every unique pair of vehicles (using nested loops)
      3. For each pair, calculate the center positions of both vehicles
      4. Calculate the distance between the centers using the Pythagorean theorem
      5. If the distance is less than half a cell (16 pixels), it's a collision

      Math explanation:

      Distance between two points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2): 

       distance = √((x2-x1)² + (y2-y1)²)
      To avoid the expensive square root operation, we compare squared distances: 
       distanceSquared = (x2-x1)² + (y2-y1)²
 threshold = 16 pixels (half a cell)
 if (distanceSquared < threshold²) → collision detected

      Parameters:
      vehicles - a collection of vehicles to check for collisions (can be Locomotives, Carriages, or both)
      Returns:
      true if any two vehicles are colliding (centers closer than 16 pixels), false if all vehicles are safely separated
